Comments:
* Network shows DISABLED probably because I installed the proprietary driver for Broadcom. I am actually connected to the internet at this moment.
* My RAM is actually 4 GB in BIOS.

=== Testing Results for UBUNTU 8.10 (DESKTOP) ===

Events in time order:

* Wireless networking works fine in live mode.
* Ubuntu Installed successfully.
* Wireless networking fine.
* Updated successfully.
* Added Persian(Iran) keyboard layout: Ctrl+C combination does not work properly in text environments (especially terminal) (tested in both BrE and USA modes). Had to remove the Persian layout. 
* Went into sleep mode successfully.
* Wake-up from sleep mode failed.
* Did not recognize Dell USB Modem shipped with the laptop (Trade Name: Conexant RD02-D400).
** wvdial says: 
   {{{ 
   --> WvDial: Internet dialer version 1.60
   --> Cannot open /dev/modem: No such file or directory
   --> Cannot open /dev/modem: No such file or directory
   --> Cannot open /dev/modem: No such file or directory
   }}}
* Ekiga did not recognize microphone, integrated webcam, and could not dial.
* Don't know any way to test fingerprint device.
* Laptop sound control keys don't work.
* Went into hibernation by pressing laptop's sleep key Fn+F1(!!) 
* Wake-up from hibernation failed.
* Wired (LAN)networking works fine.
* Administration --> Hardware Drivers:
** proprietary driver for network card installed successfully.
** Problem installing graphics driver, I had to quit the installer.
** Administration --> Hardware Drivers shows graphics driver activated. Not asking for restart.
** Running Administration --> Hardware Testing failed on graphics test (color bars)
** I Deactivated and reinstalled the graphics card. This time installation finished and asked for restart.
** After restarting Hardware Testing passed successfully.
* Added the Persian layout: the problem seems to be gone.
* Wake-up from sleep mode seems to be working properly now (don't know due to which change). The only remaining problem is the detection of external modem.
